front.title: Autonomic Networking Use Case for Distributed Detection of SLA Violations

abstract.t: This document describes a use case for autonomic networking concerning monitoring of Service Level Agreements (SLAs). The use case aims to detect violations of SLAs in a distributed fashion, striving to optimize and dynamically adapt the autonomic deployment of active measurement probes in a way that maximizes the likelihood of detecting service level violations with a given resource budget to perform active measurements, and is able to do so without any outside guidance or intervention.
